thread.title: CNN’s panel discussing the Women’s March looks a bit light on female participants
thread.title_full: CNN’s panel discussing the Women’s March looks a bit light on female participants

author: Brett T.
title: CNN’s panel discussing the Women’s March looks a bit light on female participants
text:
— Amy Laine (@hyperlaine) January 22, 2017 @TBraithwaite @CNNPolitics WTF? I am so sick of seeing white men sitting around debating women rights! Fuck you CNN! 
— Cassidy Richey (@RicheyCassidy) January 22, 2017 @TBraithwaite @PegCityLouLou most women were doing something more important. 
— Gail Conrad Davey (@dgdavey) January 22, 2017 
It’s guaranteed that most women in America were doing something far more important than appearing on CNN, while quite a few others likely were attending the Women’s March. @TBraithwaite Maybe all the women are at the March and it's just a sausage-fest at the studio. 
— Fin Debacle (@RumRational) January 22, 2017 @TBraithwaite @Fanny57 How rude and offensive. You have absolutely no idea what their gender identities are. They could all be women! 
CNN really should follow Vanderbilt’s lead and, to start, give on-air talent name tags with a selection of preferred pronouns . @TBraithwaite @KagroX as long as they are LISTENING to her… 
You just know they couldn’t help manterrupting . @TBraithwaite @mauracunningham Next up on CNN, a discussion of racism featuring a panel of all white men.
